Keeping siblings together can be a huge help in preventing that kind of trauma. I've read that some foster care systems are actually starting to prioritize keeping siblings together, but it's a complex issue and there are a lot of factors at play. There definitely needs to be more resources allocated to foster care, like training for foster parents on the importance of sibling relationships and how to support them. I think part of the problem is that it's still a pretty taboo topic, but at the same time, I think there's a growing awareness and willingness to listen and learn. It's heartening to see that there are organizations and advocates working to raise awareness and push for change. I definitely think individuals can make a difference by raising awareness and advocating for change, but I also believe that systemic changes are crucial for long-lasting impact.
